intro: Puccinellia novae-zealandiae, commonly known as New Zealand glassworts, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its succulent, prostrate growth habit. The plant typically produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or purple in color. It thrives in coastal and saline environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Puccinellia novae-zealandiae plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for native invertebrates.
